name: nl
longDescription: Write each FILE to standard output, with line numbers added.

options.name: body-numbering
options.description: Select the numbering style for lines in the body section of each logical page.  When a line is not numbered, the current line number is not incremented, but the line number separator character is still prepended to the line.  The styles are:

options.name: starting-line-number
options.description: Set the initial line number on each logical page to NUMBER (default 1).

options.name: no-renumber
options.description: Do not reset the line number at the start of a logical page.

options.name: join-blank-lines
options.description: Consider NUMBER (default 1) consecutive empty lines to be one logical line for numbering, and only number the last one.  Where fewer than NUMBER consecutive empty lines occur, do not number them.  An empty line is one that contains no characters, not even spaces or tabs.

options.name: number-separator
options.description: Separate the line number from the text line in the output with STRING (default is the TAB character).

options.name: number-width
options.description: Use NUMBER characters for line numbers (default 6).

options.name: number-format
options.description: Select the line numbering format (default is ‘rn’):

options.name: section-delimiter
options.description: Set the section delimiter characters to CD; default is ‘\:’.  If only C is given, the second remains ‘:’.  (Remember to protect ‘\’ or other metacharacters from shell expansion with quotes or extra backslashes.)
